slides.title: Video
slides.content:
# Video üìπ

Use `<video>` to play clips. Use multiple `<source>` tags for browser compatibility.

```html
<video controls width="400" poster="thumb.jpg">
  <source src="vid.mp4" type="video/mp4">
  <source src="vid.webm" type="video/webm">
  Your browser doesn't support video.
</video>
```

- `poster`: Image shown while video loads
- `controls`: Shows play/volume buttons

slides.title: Audio
slides.content:
# Audio üéµ

Similar to video, use `<audio>` for sound.

```html
<audio controls loop>
  <source src="song.mp3" type="audio/mpeg">
  <source src="song.ogg" type="audio/ogg">
</audio>
```

- `controls`: Must include this or user can't play it!
- `loop`: Plays heavily
- `muted`: Starts muted

slides.title: Embedding content
slides.content:
# Embedding Frames üñºÔ∏è

Use `<iframe>` to embed another webpage inside yours (like a YouTube video or Google Map).

```html
<iframe 
    src="https://www.google.com/maps/embed..." 
    width="600" 
    height="450">
</iframe>
```

> üí° **Fun Fact:** Most YouTube videos you see on other sites are just iframes!
